title: Real-world benchmarking of cloud storage providers: Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage, and Azure Blob Storage
description:
I really wouldn’t mind moving from Dropbox to S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Storage, or any other provider

Recently at work I’ve been using the fancy new 4K iMac, yet when I’m at home or out-and-about, I use my equivalently-sexy MacBook. I do the same stuff on both computers though, it just so happens that one is way faster and has a bigger screen, and the other is slower though portable and much more practical for my lifestyle. They both need access to the same files.

Typically to solve this problem you’d use Dropbox or a similar service. But one thing I strongly dislike about specifically Dropbox is that it really wants you to sync everything to

title: Running a .NET app against a Postgres database in Docker
description: Some days/weeks/time ago, I did a presentation at MeasureUP called “Docker For People Who Think Docker Is This Weird Linux Thing That Doesn’t Impact Me”. The slides for that presentation can be found here and the sample application here. Using …
